values.help: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF. Default 255.
values.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF

items.label: ALL ON active / ALL OFF active
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled

values.help: Activate/Deactivate association sending for group 1 - Note: Parameter 15 must set to 1 to work properly. Default 0.
values.label: Separation of association sending (key 1)

items.label: Map status to all devices in group 1 (default)
Map OFF status to all devices in group 1, Double click on key 1 will send ON to all devices in group 1, all dimmers set to prev.value
Map OFF status to all devices in group 1, Double click on key 1 will send ON to all devices in group 1, all dimmers set to 100%

values.help: Key no.2 is not represented by any physical device except of devices on association list. This functionality prevents of lack of reaction on pressing key no.2 through polling devices from association list one by one and checking their actual statuses. Default 1.
values.label: Control key #2 behaviour

items.label: Frame GET not send. Device status is not checked
Frame GET is send. Device status is checked before send

values.help: Options for changing parameter 1-99. Default 1.
values.label: Dimming step at automatic control

values.help:
Options for changing parameter 1-255 (10ms - 2,5s).
      Default 5.
values.label: Time of MANUALLY moving between the extreme dimming values

values.help: Options for changing parameter 1-255 (10ms - 2,5s) - 0: this value disables the smooth change in light intensity. Default 1. ATTENTION: value 0 is required for inductive and capacitive devices unsuitable for dimming (e.g. fluorescent lamps, motors, etc...)
values.label: Time of AUTOMATIC moving between the extreme dimming values

values.help: Options for changing parameter 1-99. Default 1.
values.label: Dimming step at manual control

values.help: Options for changing parameter 2-99. Default 99.
values.label: Maximum dimmer level control

values.help: Options for changing parameter 1-98. Default 2.
values.label: Minimum dimmer level control

values.help: Binary inputs type configuration. Default 0.
values.label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration

items.label: Mono-stable input (button)
Bi-stable input (switch)
Role blind switch (UP / DOWN) - two switch keys operate the Dimmer

values.help: Double-click set lighting at 100%. Default 1.
values.label: Double click option

items.label: Disable double click
Enable double click

values.help: Saving state before power failure. Default 1.
values.label: Saving state before power failure

items.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

values.help: The function of 3-way switch provides the option to double key no. 1. The dimmer may control two bi-stable push-buttons or an infinite number of mono-stable push-buttons. Default 0.
values.label: 3-way switch

items.label: Disable
Enable

values.help: The dimmer communicate the level to the associated devices. Default 0.
values.label: Synchronizing light level for associated devices

items.label: Disable
Enable

values.help: This function allow user to change [On-Off] bi-stable keys (parameter no. 14). Default 0.
values.label: Change [On-Off] bi-stable keys

items.label: Disable
Enable

values.help: This function will enable decreasing the minimum level of the Dimmer by extending the control impulse.[100 - 170]. By changing the minimum level, the user may completely dim LED bulbs. Not all LED bulbs available on the market have the dimmming option. WARNING: Wrong setting of the function may cause incorrect operation of the Dimmer. INFO: THIS PARAMETER IS NOT AVAILABLE IN DEVICE FGD211 v2.1-2.3
values.label: ADVANCED Impulse length

values.help:
Alarm of any type (general alarm, water flooding alarm, smoke alarm: CO, CO2, temperature alarm).
      Default 3.
values.label: Alarm

items.label: DEACTIVATION - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

values.help: Amount of time the device keeps on flashing after receipt of Alarm Frame (1ms-65535ms). Default 600.
values.label: Active flashing alarm time

values.help: Available settings: from 1 to 99 Parameters value changes depending on the dimming level.
values.label: Updating the dimming level without the input from the switch

values.help: The device offers the possibility of sending commands compatible with Command class scene activation. Information is sent to devices assigned to association group no. 3. Controllers such as Home Center 2 are able to interpret such commands and based on these commands they activate scenes, to which specific scene IDs have been assigned. The user may expand the functionality of the button connected to inputs S1 and S2 by distinguishing the actions of keys connected to those inputs. For example: double click would activate the scene goodnight and triple click would activate the scene morning. Default 0.
values.label: Scene activation functionality

items.label: Functionality deactivated
Functionality activated
